stream.data

Class Tuple

  • java.lang.Object
    • stream.data.Tuple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Tuple
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Tuple represents an object that can contain an arbitrary number of attributes.
    Author:
    Jeong-Hyon Hwang (jhh@cs.albany.edu)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tuple(double timestamp)
      Constructs a Tuple.
      Tuple(java.lang.String[] attributes, java.lang.Object[] values, double timestamp)
      Constructs a Tuple containing the specified attributes and values.
      Tuple(Tuple other)
      Constructs a Tuple as a clone of the specified Tuple.
      Tuple(Tuple t1, Tuple t2)
      Constructs a Tuple by concatenating two specified Tuples.

      • update

        public java.lang.Object update(java.lang.String attributeName,
                      java.lang.Object attributeValue)
        Updates this Tuple based on the specified attribute.
        Parameters:
        attributeName - the name of the attribute.
        attributeValue - the new value of the attribute; if null the specified attribute is removed from this Tuple.
        Returns:
        the previous value of the specified attribute; null if none.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.Object evaluate(Expression expression)
                          throws UnboundVariableException
        Evaluates the specified ArithmeticExpression using the attribute values of this Tuple.
        Parameters:
        expression - an ArithmeticExpression.
        Returns:
        the result of evaluating the specified ArithmeticExpression.
        Throws:
        UnboundVariableException - if the ArithmeticExpression contains a variable whose value is not set.

      • values

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> values(java.lang.String[] attributes)
        Returns a collection of values of the specified attributes.
        Parameters:
        attributes - the attributes whose values will be retrieved.
        Returns:
        a collection of values of the specified attributes.
